We love our children and teenagers,but t: We love our children and teenagers,but the stresses of COVID-19,money and lockdown can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
The same things usually make us get stre: The same things usually make us get stressed and angry every time
What makes you angry?When does it happen: What makes you angry?When does it happen?How do you normally react?
Prevent it from starting.If it happens w: Prevent it from starting.If it happens when you are tired,get some sleep or rest.If its hunger,try to be sure you can eat.If its feeling alone,ask someone for support
Look after yourself.Try the \"take a pau: Look after yourself.Try the "take a pause" and "managing stress" resource sheets for ideas
When you start feeling angry,take a 20-s: When you start feeling angry,take a 20-second cool down.Breathe in and out slowly 5 times before you speak or move
Go somewhere else for ten minutes to reg: Go somewhere else for ten minutes to regain control of your emotions.If you have outdoor space,go outside
If its a baby that wont stop crying,its: If its a baby that wont stop crying,its OK to leave them safely on their back and walk away for a bit.Call someone to calm you down.Check on them every 5-10 minutes
We all need to connect.Talk to friends,: We all need to connect.Talk to friends, family,and other support networks every day
Cut back on drinking or dont drink,espec: Cut back on drinking or dont drink,especially when the kids are awake
Do you have weapons or things that can b: Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hit others?Lock them up,hide them or take them out of the home
If its not safe for them at home it is O: If its not safe for them at home it is OK for children to go out to get help or stay somewhere else for a while
Brain science shows if you control your: Brain science shows if you control your anger or do something positive you increase your childs brain development.
